info.title: LiveChat REST API
info.description:
## Introduction

Welcome to the LiveChat API documentation!

Our API provides a set of flexible tools which you can use to create new outstanding projects. We smile a bit more each time we see skilled developers unleash their creativity!

Please note that this documentation refers to the latest API version: 2.0. If you are looking for the previous version, check out the deprecated API 1.0 documentation.

## Basic API usage

All LiveChat API requests start with  `https://api.livechatinc.com/`.

Please note that all LiveChat API requests must use \`HTTPS\` protocol.

The next segment of the URL path depends on the type of your request. For example, use:  `https://api.livechatinc.com/agents`  to get or modify the agents data.

All requests must have \`X-API-VERSION\` header set to the number of the version that you'd like to use. The most recent version is 2.

## Authentication

Two common authentication methods are supported:  **OAuth 2.0**  and  **API key**.

### OAuth 2.0

OAuth 2.0 au

delete.description: Deletes a webhook with the given ID.

get.description: Shows how many chats have been rated and how they have been rated during a specified period.
Returns the list of all currently set canned responses.

put.description: Updates the specified canned response by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

delete.description: Removes a canned response with the given CANNED_RESPONSE_ID.

put.description: Updates the specified group by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

delete.description: Removes a group with the given GROUP_ID.

get.description: This report shows you where you get your chats from. They can come from i.e. automatic invitations, manual invitations or the visitors can start the chats by themselves.
Returns the list of all greetings.

post.description: Use this function to create a new greeting.

get.description: Returns a list of webhooks that have been created in a LiveChat account.

Returns the “greetings to chats to goals” conversion rates report.

displayed is the number of displayed greetings. accepted tells you how many chats resulted from these greetings. goals tells you how many goals resulted from these greetings.
Returns tags from all groups.

post.description: Adds a new tag. Note that only the owner and the admins are authorized to use this.

get.description: Returns complete details of the agent for the given LOGIN.

put.description: Returns complete details of the agent for the given LOGIN.

get.description: Returns all tickets.
Shows the number of the tickets solved during the specified period.
The average amount of time it takes the agents to respond to a new chat over a specified period of time.
Returns the list of all currently set canned responses.
Shows the ratio of good to bad ratings for each operator.
Returns all created groups.

post.description: Creates a new group in your license.

get.description: Returns a single chat item for the given CHAT_ID.
Shows the distribution of the tickets between various channels.
Returns the specified greeting.
Returns group details for the given GROUP_ID.
Shows how many chats occurred during the specified period.
Returns all currently set goals. The active parameter indicates whether a goal is enabled or not.
Returns all ended chats.
Returns all LiveChat agents list

post.description: Creates a new agent in your license.

get.description: Returns the goal details for the given GOAL_ID.

put.description:
Updates the specified goal by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

The GOAL_ID is obtained from the goals list.

delete.description: Removes a goal with the given GOAL_ID.

get.description: Shows the tickets that were rated during the specified period.

put.description: Updates tags associated with the ticket.

get.description: Shows the ratio of good to bad ratings for each operator.
The average amount of time it takes the agents to respond to a new message in a chat during a specified period.

Shows how long an agent (or a group or the whole account) was available for chatting during a specified period. When querying for one day, the results are shown in minutes per every hour, otherwise in hours for each day.

put.description: This method updates the tags assigned to a chat.

get.description: Returns a list of the visitors on the pages with the tracking code installed.
Shows the resolution time of the tickets that were solved during the specified period.

delete.description:
Deletes a tag from the chosen group. The agents will no longer be able to tag chats and tickets using this tag.

Deleting a tag will not remove it from the archived chats and tickets.

get.description: Shows the number of reached goals.
Shows how many visitors waited in the queue and how many abandoned the queue or proceeded to chats
Shows the Minimum, Average and Maximum waiting time.
Shows how much time an agent (or a group) spent on chatting during a specified period. When querying for one day, the results are shown in minutes per every hour, otherwise in hours for each day.

post.description: The GOAL_ID is obtained from the goals list.

get.description: Returns the current LiveChat status. Available return values: online, offline.

put.description: Use this request to change the name or message of a greeting.

get.description: Shows the time of the first response to the tickets that were responded to for the first time during the specified period.
This request shows the maximum number of concurrent chats that happened at the same hour on a particular day.

post.description: Displays additional information about a visitor in LiveChat apps.

get.description: Returns a single ticket item for the given TICKET_ID
Shows the number of the tickets created during the specified period.
